item.title: Ticket #149 (Cannot choose scroll bars to choose categories in Mac IE 5.1) created
item.dc:creator: shell
item.description:
I am running Mac OS 9 and using IE 5.1

We have a lot of categories on our blog, and the "new post" screen shows them with a scroll bar. On the PC, the scrollbars work, but they do not work on the Mac. We can only choose among the categories that are visible without scrolling.

item.title: Ticket #148 (view paginated pages as single entry for printing) created
item.dc:creator: Grod
item.description: When using pagination in an entry it should be possible to provide an alternate permalink that gives a printer friendly page. This page would ignore occurances of <!--nextpage--> in a post. This would be useful from an accessibility standpoint , for printing, and for those readers who prefer scrolling over clicking to the next page. The link should be added automatically to the normal permalink in the form of an icon or "print this" text.

item.title: Ticket #2 ( posting per xmlrpc - works, but gives errmsgs ala "invalid xml") updated
item.dc:creator: sdevore
item.description: I regularly get truncated responses when getting postTitles and categories via xmlrpc in some clients but not others

item.title: Ticket #147 (Comment Mass Edit Mode - Delete all checked comments does not delete) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When in Comment Mass Edit Mode - Delete all checked comments does not delete. I select a number of comments to delete, and after pressed the Delete all checked comments, the comments still appear on the list, even after refreshing the page. You can get around it by pressing delete for each individual comment - however, not sure why the delete at the bottom of the page doesn't work properly.

item.title: Ticket #146 (.feedback CSS doesn't validate) created
item.dc:creator: lowmagnet
item.description:
From the validator:

Line: 0 Context : .feedback

Invalid number : clearall is not a clear value : all

item.title: Ticket #145 (wp-admin/categories.php has hardcoded presentational elements) created
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
In wp-admin/categories.php, the alternate background color for the table cells is coded into the html (as gray) rather than using the .alternate class in wp-admin.css.

This is a bug because it is inconsistent with the rest of the backend (e.g. wp-admin/links-manager.php) and goes against the Wordpress philosophy of controlling presentation through CSS.
